com.software.reuze

Class ga_Polygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.ga_Polygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ga_i_PolygonHolder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ga_PolygonAwtShape

    public class ga_Polygon
extends Object
implements ga_i_PolygonHolder
    A cool polygon class that's got some pretty useful geometry methods. Note that the polygon can be convex or concave but it should not have intersecting sides. Some code is from here: http://www.cs.princeton.edu/introcs/35purple/Polygon.java.html and Joseph O'Rourke: http://exaflop.org/docs/cgafaq/cga2.html Another good source Paul Bourke: http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/
    Author:
    Keith Woodward

        public ga_Polygon reduceVertices(float minEdgeLen)
        Reduces the number of vertices in the polygon based on the given minimum edge length. Only vertices with at least this distance between them will be kept.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        itself

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(float x,
                 float y,
                 float w,
                 float h)
        Unlike Shape.intersects, this method is exact. Note that this method should really be called overlaps(x,y,w,h) since it doesn't just test for line-line intersection.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        w -
        h -
        Returns:
        Returns true if the given rectangle overlaps this polygon.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(float x,
               float y,
               float w,
               float h)
        Unlike Shape.contains, this method is exact.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        w -
        h -
        Returns:
        Returns true if the given rectangle wholly fits inside this polygon with no perimeter intersections.

      • getCentroid

        public ga_Vector2 getCentroid()
        Computes the polygon's center of mass. Code ported from: http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/polyarea/
        Returns:
        centroid point

      • constrain

        public ga_Vector2 constrain(ga_Vector2 target)
        Constrains the target vector to the perimeter of this polygon. Unlike the #constrain(ga_Rectangle) version of this method, this version DOES NOT check containment automatically. If you want to only constrain a point if its (for example) outside the polygon, then check containment with contains(ga_Vector2) first before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        target -
        Returns:
        target, possibly modified

      • removeDuplicates

        public ga_Polygon removeDuplicates(float tolerance)
        Removes duplicate vertices from the polygon. Only successive points are recognized as duplicates.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - snap distance for finding duplicates
        Returns:
        itself

      • smooth

        public ga_Polygon smooth(float amount,
                float baseWeight)
        Applies a laplacian-style smooth operation to all polygon vertices, causing sharp corners/angles to widen and results in a general smoother shape. Let the current vertex be A and its neighbors P and Q, then A will be moved by a specified amount into the direction given by (P-A)+(Q-A). Additionally, and to avoid shrinking of the shape through repeated iteration of this procedure, the vector A - C (Polygon centroid) is added as counter force and a weight for its impact can be specified. To keep the average size of the polygon stable, this weight value should be ~1/2 of the smooth amount. TODO repeated application causes a slow drift to the left
        Parameters:
        amount - smooth amount (between 0 < x < 0.5)
        baseWeight - counter weight (0 <= x < 1/2 * smooth amount)
        Returns:
        itself
